meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: I cringe when I see a spider.
meanings.sent2: She cringes at the thought of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to swim made me cringe.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure makes me cringe like a scared mouse.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made me cringe in fear.

meanings.definition: A feeling of embarrassment or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: His cringe was visible when he realized his mistake.
meanings.sent2: The cringe on her face showed she was uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The cringe on his face was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her cringe was like a bright red flag of embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The cringe in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: An action or behavior that causes embarrassment or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: His joke was a cringe that no one found funny.
meanings.sent2: The awkward silence after his cringe was deafening.
meanings.sent3: The cringe at the party was unforgettable.
meanings.sent4: Her cringe was a spotlight on the awkward situation.
meanings.sent5: The cringe in the air was suffocating.
